titlestmt.titleproper: Fahnestock, French and Co. ledger and Jonathan French and Co. letterbook 1864-1872
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Fahnestock, French and Co. ledger and Jonathan French and Co. letterbook
did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Fahnestock, French and Co. was a firm of merchants operating in nineteenth century. Jonathan French and Co. was a firm of fish merchants, possibly is Eastport, Maine.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two volumes: The first is a sales, advertising, and commission ledger of Fahnestock, French & Co; the volume includes newspaper advertisements of Fahnestock, French & Co. for the Gold Medal Sewing Machine and advertisements seeking sales agents. There is also a blank bill head for Fahnestock, French & Co. and a printed pamphlet of instructions to sales agents. This ledger dates from 1871-1872. The other volume in the collection is a letterbook of the firm Jonathan French and Sons, 1864-1867. The letters in the volume relate largely to shipments of and payment for fish.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
